result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shawn R. Zerr

records.addlTxt:
8:38 AM  Prosecuting attorney Alexander Huber in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Shawn R. Zerr in court.  Attorney Christopher William Rose in court for Shawn R. Zerr. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: Attorney Rose states the matter is resolved and DE would like to accept the State's offer. Attorney Rose is requesting a plea/sentencing date. The State does not object.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 10:30 am.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  *Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *No Weapons especially firearms.   *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.**Court will allow contact with Julie A.B. but no discussion of case. DE must attend at least 4 AA meeting every week.*

10:16 AM   Attorney Dan Tombasco appeared for the State. Defendant, Shawn R. Zerr, appeared with Attorney Christopher William Rose.  Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES:   Victim rights compliance. Bond motion filed by Attorney Rose. Victim addresses the Court. State object to the bond motion. For reasons set forth on the record Court modifies bond conditions allow contact with Julie A.B. but no discussion of case and DE must attend at least 4 AA meeting every week. All previous conditions remain. Leave on for the next scheduled court activity.

01:57 PM   Attorney Dan Tombasco appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Darrell Watts under supervision of Ben Schwarz. Clerk: PU.  The Court finds probable cause in this case today.  Def. is referred to the Public Defender.  If not eligible, def. to retain his own counsel. Court date will not be adjourned due to def.'s failure to retain counsel.  Plea of Not Guilty entered.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 01:45 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 08:30 am. $1000  Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event).  ec
